alert.note: Alert for Central Gunnison and Uncompahgre River Basin; Four Corners, Upper Dolores River; Northwestern San Juan Mountains; Paradox Valley, Lower Dolores River; Southwest San Juan Mountains; Uncompahgre Plateau, Dallas Divide (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 03 at 5:36PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...HEAVY SNOW BAND... HAZARDS...A band of heavy snow accompanied by winds of up to 30 MPH which can rapidly reduce visibility to less than one mile. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 535 PM MDT, a band of heavy snow was along a line extending from 17 miles north of Naturita to 9 miles east of Nucla to 8 miles south of Norwood to 15 miles northeast of Dolores and moving east at 25 MPH. THIS BAND OF HEAVY SNOW WILL BE NEAR... Norwood around 545 PM MDT. Sawpit around 615 PM MDT. This includes the following highways... Colorado 62 between mile markers 1 and 9. Colorado 90 between mile markers 25 and 33. Colorado 141 between mile markers 34 and 77. Colorado 145 between mile markers 48 and 54, and between mile markers 76 and 116. SAFETY INFO... Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this band of heavy snow. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads may lead to accidents. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. &&
